snippet: Bank robbers are subject to mandatory 10-year sentence increases if they force others to accompany them for even very short distances, the Supreme Court ruled.
abstract: Supreme Court rules unanimously that bank robbers who force others to accompany them, even for short distance, are subject to mandatory 10-year sentences; decision concerns case of North Carolina man who entered home of woman after fleeing botched robbery attempt and forced her to move from room to room; woman suffered fatal heart attack.
lead_paragraph: Bank robbers are subject to mandatory 10-year sentence increases if they force others to accompany them for even very short distances, the Supreme Court ruled.

headline.main: Supreme Court Takes Broad View on Hostage-Taker’s Penalty
headline.print_headline: Justices Take Broad View on Hostage-Taker’s Penalty
